poem:
**Crude Consequences**

Oil's slow dance to the beat of pandemic drums,
Market prices slumped beneath the weight
Of surplus and uncertainty.
Pumps churn, relentless—a flow unneeded,
While watchdogs whisper warnings to the world.
In the margins, shadows stretch longer,
Echoes of a thirst unquenched.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The global energy watchdog used its closely watched monthly report to warn the industry that oil market prices could continue to fall as the leading producers kept pumping out more". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
